Text.Value: ... oh, damnation. My friend, Thale - what... what happened?

EditorData.NodeContext: Swearing low - she's just seen that her friend is dead

Text.Value: It... drew us. We couldn't stop even when we dashed our boat against the shore. What now?

EditorData.NodeContext: Wonder, horror and helplessness at how easily the monster controlled them. Now their boat is destroyed and they're stuck.

Text.Value: That monster was using you like a puppet.
No! Just... just keep away, all right? I'll go my way, you go yours. Please.

EditorData.NodeContext: Defiant but fearful, aiming to get away from us as quickly as possible

Text.Value: By who? We're miles from anyone and anywhere. Even if -

EditorData.NodeContext: Breaking off suddenly

Text.Value: You were protecting that creature.
We came to help. Umberlee's law - never pass a wreck. Even if it... comes from the sky.

EditorData.NodeContext: Pushing back on the idea that their situation is their fault - they had good intentions

Text.Value: The back-arse of beyond. Baldur's Gate is a few days downriver, but -

EditorData.NodeContext: Breaking off suddenly

Text.Value: Calm yourself - you're safe now.
...The voice. Oh, gods, the voice. What happened?!

EditorData.NodeContext: Reality comes crashing in, quiet horror as she realises she was under some terrible voice's control

Text.Value: ... aye, me and all. We were fishing - just getting ready to haul our nets in when we saw the crash.

EditorData.NodeContext: A pause to begin with, as she digests the information that we had to kill her friends. They were under the control of a monster and trying to kill us. She's bitter and sad, but it's not fully directed at us.

Text.Value: That thing was in the wreckage. Whatever it did... imagine everyone you've ever loved, screaming for help in one voice.

EditorData.NodeContext: Her anger is directed at the monster and how it took control of their minds.

Text.Value: ... oh, damnation. My friends - what... what happened?

EditorData.NodeContext: Swearing low - she's just seen that her friends are dead

Text.Value: Your boat - can it be repaired?
You tried to kill me, that's what.
It looked like you were helping that thing.
Gods... my head...

EditorData.NodeContext: 'Coming to' from being mentally dominated - groggy and disoriented

Text.Value: I've seen enough blood today, all right?

EditorData.NodeContext: Fearful but defiant - she's trying to get as far away from us as possible but we've followed her and she doesn't want to start a fight

Text.Value: I'm not staying in this damned place.
Figure it out yourself. I have neither time nor patience to train a new slave.
Aye, I... I remember now. We saw the crash from out on the river, flocked to it like damn fools.

EditorData.NodeContext: Slowly coming to grips, frustrated and bitter at how they rushed to help and were used.

Text.Value: We shouldn't have come here... we had to come here.
First things first. Where are we?
Arms? We're damn fisherfolk! We saw the crash and came to help, more fool us.

EditorData.NodeContext: Frustrated, upset - her friends died trying to kill us. She can't blame us, but knows it wasn't their fault either

Text.Value: Show some gratitude, or you'll find that I'm a lot worse.
No! Just... just keep away, all right? We'll go our way, you go yours. Please.

EditorData.NodeContext: Defiant but fearful, aiming to get away from us as quickly as possible

Text.Value: What? No!
Good riddance. We were fishing on the river when we saw the crash.

EditorData.NodeContext: Nodding, remembering - and spitting the phrase with venom - she HATES this thing that was controlling her

Text.Value: I was defending myself. I'm sorry.
Start by handing over your valuables.
What? I saved you from that thing.
No. They did... something to me, but I escaped.
It's where you landed that matters. The middle of bloody nowhere. Now-

EditorData.NodeContext: Brushing off our self-pity, refocusing on the dilemma - that we're in dangerous territory

Text.Value: That monster was using you like a puppet.
... oh, damnation. My friend, Gan - what... what happened?

EditorData.NodeContext: Swearing low - she's just seen that her friend is dead

Text.Value: This voice - what was it saying?
It could be worse - your ship didn't fall from the sky.
Calm? One moment we're hauling in our nets, and the next the damn sky is falling in!

EditorData.NodeContext: Frustrated, annoyed that we're telling her to calm down when we haven't been through what she has

Text.Value: Wait. Your mind - I can... feel it. You're like them - those creatures!

EditorData.NodeContext: a pause and grasp of the head - then she looks at us with horror. She's getting the same psychic energy from us that she got from the beast

Text.Value: You allowed the ghaik to use you. You're unclean.
Whatever was happening, it ended with that monster.
... imagine everyone you've ever loved, screaming for help in one voice. It drove us mad.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gathering herself, relating the experience and emphasising that it's not one we would like to go through

Text.Value: I'm no more eager to cosy up to you, drow, but we're in the wilderness. If we want to -

EditorData.NodeContext: Brushing aside our distaste

Text.Value: Aye... I remember. We saw the crash from the river, and heard... something.

EditorData.NodeContext: Slowly remembering, piecing together how they found the monster

Text.Value: The same thing that happens to anyone who takes up arms against me.
Keep back. Back!

EditorData.NodeContext: Fearful but defiant - she's trying to get as far away from us as possible but we've followed her and she doesn't want to start a fight
